results.title: The Civil War. Episode 3, 1862--forever free
results.creator_credit: Ken Burns, Ric Burns, WETA-TV and Florentine Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Civil War”.
The Union giant appears helpless. McClellan abandons his attempt to capture Richmond. The talk in Washington is that the North may lose the war, but Lincoln grimly pursues his course. What started as a struggle to preserve the Union is now becoming a crusade against slavery, but Lincoln needs a victory and at a small creek called Antietam he achieves it, at the cost of 23,000 lives, the bloodiest day of the war. General Robert E. Lee retreats and Lincoln issues his Emancipation Proclamation.

group_works.title: Who killed the sale?
group_works.creator_credit: Michael Tuchner, Anthony Pelissier, Ian Latimer and Rank Organisation Short Films Group

results.title: Who killed the sale?
results.creator_credit: Michael Tuchner, Anthony Pelissier, Ian Latimer and Rank Organisation Short Films Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Customer and You”.
An amusing film in Cleese style of a case study which shows that employees in all parts of a company can affect a company’s ability to get and to keep business. With Bud Tingwell.

results.title: David Coleman: cabinet maker
results.creator_credit: Michael Dibb, John Read and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Craftsman”.
David Coleman and his assistants make beautiful reproduction antique furniture in a workshop in the little village of Stebbing, Essex, almost all of which is exported to the U.S.A

results.title: Notes on a harpsichord
results.creator_credit: David Cheshire, John Read and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Craftsman”.
Follows a harpsichord from its construction to a concert performance. Philip Ledger, who is Musical Director of the Aldeburgh Festival and is one of Britain’s finest continuo players, describes the basic features of the harpsichord, and introduces the man who maintains and tunes his own harpsichord for concert performance - Malcolm Russell.

results.title: The Civil War. Eps. 4-6
results.creator_credit: Ken Burns, Ric Burns, WETA-TV and Florentine Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Civil War”.
SIMPLY MURDER: The war is in its third year and enthusiasm for the fighting has fled. In their awful camps men are dying of disease at the rate of two for every one slain in combat. Yet the struggle goes on. Robert E. Lee devastates the Union at Fredericksburg and Chancellorsville but at great cost. At Vicksburg Ulysses S. Grant lays siege to the rebel stronghold, slowly throttling the South’s lifeline. Meanwhile General Lee prepares to invade Maryland and Pennsylvania, thereby setting the stage for the war’s greatest battle. THE UNIVERSE OF BATTLE: Feeling invincible after the spring’s great victories, Lee drives north to Gettysburg and three of the most crucial days of the war. 51,000 men fall, one in every three, and when the firing dies, General Lee is in retreat, never again to threaten the North. Grant seizes Vicksburg and the rebels are soundly defeated in Tennessee, but the first military draft provokes a series of anti-war, anti-black riots. Scarcely noticed in all the hubbub is Lincoln’s visit to Gettysburg and the address in which he defines the Union and the war in a mere 269 words. VALLEY OF THE SHADOW OF DEATH: For three years Robert E. Lee has met, measured and defeated a string of Union generals, but now Lincoln elevates Ulysses S. Grant to commander of all Union armies and brings him east to face the brilliant Lee. In a month-long series of battles, Grant’s army loses an appalling 50,000 men, but, heedless of the carnage he drives his superior numbers towards Richmond until halted at Petersburg. Meanwhile, Sherman relentlessly advances to Atlanta, until he too is halted. Time is running out for Lincoln. Narrated by David McCullough.

results.title: Matcham Skipper: metal sculptor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Craftman and His Environment”.
A study of Matcham Skipper, one of Australia’s best known workers in silver, making jewellery and sculpting in silver at his studio in the old artists’ colony of Montsalvat, Victoria, in 1973. The film features the process of lost-wax casting. The film was funded by the Crafts Board of the Australia Council.

results.title: The Chronicles of Narnia [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Marilyn Fox, Alex Kirby, Paul Stone and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Chronicles of Narnia”.
A breathtaking live action, made for television rendition of C. S. Lewis’ powerful fantasy for all ages using stunning special effects to recreate the most exciting and enchanting adventure of them all. “The Lion, the witch and the wardrobe”: four children, sent from London into the countryside during the dangerous period of WW2, discover the magical world of Narnia - where dwarves, nymphs and giants reside, fauns carry umbrellas, animals talk and horses fly. It is also the land of Aslan, the great lion who can warm the coldest heart and his arch-enemy, the White Witch. “Prince Caspian”: Troubled times have come to Narnia and the evil King Miraz and his scheming Queen Prunaprismia have brought misery and an army of destruction to the peaceful land. Young Prince Caspian, rightful heir to the throne vows to save his kingdom and calls upon the aid of Peter, Susan, Edmund and Lucy. “The Voyage of the dawn treader”: A new quest begins for Edmund and Lucy, who, with their horrible cousin Eustace, join King Caspian on a voyage to find seven missing Lords of Narnia. The Silver chair Old King Caspian’s only son and heir, Prince Rillian has disappeared. The great lion, Aslan, calls on Jill and Eustace, guiding them in their search for the lost prince. On their perilous quest, the children meet up with Puddleglum who travels with them to the land of giants. Their search leads them to face the Green Witch, the Queen of the Deep Realm whose spell they must break. Each edition also available separately on VHS [301499], [301990], [302722].
